txt.en: High Time to Ride TBD THIS NEEDS TO MOVE TO SCYLFIG
The Noble Guard

'The battle looms near, and we are as prepared as we will ever be! We have Thrymm on our side, my brave daughter, and the brave kindred of our Reeve, Gárwig.\n\n'Will you speak with Gársig, the son of the Reeve, and make sure he has everything he needs? The Reeve's grandsons are here also, and ready to fight -- Humbald and Grimgar. Please help them however you can.'
High Time to Ride
Gárwig needs to be informed that Scylfig is prepared for the coming attack. He is located in the Mead Hall.

'Thrymm was right about you, [placeholder]. We wouldn't have been prepared without you. We're as ready as we'll ever be for this attack. We need to inform the Reeve Gárwig that preparations have been made.

'Ride as fast as you can and speak with Gárwig in Forlaw.

'You will find Gárwig in the Mead Hall. Forlaw is south of Scylfig.'
TBD.
Grimgar feels that Scylfig is well-prepared for the White Hand Orc assault

'You bring word from Scylfig that they are as prepared as they're going to be? Well, I'm not quite sure it will be enough. We've endured more than most have over the last several weeks. I shoulder the burden of the people and it is a heavy one.'
Cyneberg needs a messenger to ride to Forlaw as quickly as possible.
Humbald is excited to assist in the defence of Scylfig

'You bring word from Scylfig that they are as prepared as they're going to be? Well, I'm not quite sure it will be enough. We've endured more than most have over the last several weeks. I shoulder the burden of the people and it is a heavy one. '
Gárwig needs to be informed that Scylfig is prepared for the coming attack. He is located in the Mead Hall.
tbd

'Thrymm was right about you, [placeholder]. We wouldn't have been prepared without you. We're as ready as we'll ever be for this attack. We need to inform Gárwig that preparations have been made.

'Ride as fast as you can and speak with Gárwig in Forlaw.

'You will find Gárwig in the Mead Hall. Forlaw is south of Scylfig.'

'Another strong soldier to brave the Orcs' assault? Excellent!

'As grandson of the Reeve, my duty is similar to that of a wandering hero such as yourself -- to assist where I am needed!

'I relish a good fight. Let the Orcs come!'

'Ah, welcome to the battle-ground! I do not need any help, but thank you for asking.\n\n'With the greatest strength of Wildermore's people gathered here, it would take a great army of Orcs to conquer Scylfig.'
Gársig valiantly upholds his duty as a noble protector of Wildermore

'I am Gársig, son of Gárwig. Thrymm sent us warning not long ago of an unusual number of Orcs in the Writhendowns, and we have come to lend our arms to the defence of Scylfig.

'The Reeve's kin are responsible for the protection of these lands. We suffer no enemy to pass our borders!

'Thrymm is like a brother to me. I look forward to drawing swords with him once more.'
A number of nobles from the Reeve's family have taken up arms for the coming attack on Scylfig.
Arrived at Forlaw
Speak with Grimgar, grandson of Reeve Gárwig
Speak with Gárwig in the Forlaw Mead Hall
The kin of the Reeve of Wildermore can be found in Scylfig.\n\nYou should see if the Reeve's son or grandsons need any assistance.
TBD
Ride to Forlaw
Speak with Gárwig in the Forlaw Mead Hall
Cyneberg can be found sharpening her sword in Scylfig.\n\nYou should speak with Cyneberg.
Speak with Gársig, son of Reeve Gárwig
Speak with Cyneberg

Now that preparations have been made for the coming attack at Scylfig, Cyneberg wanted to make sure that Gárwig was aware that the people of Scylfig have done all they can and are awaiting the attack.

Now that preparations have been made for the coming attack at Scylfig, Cyneberg wanted to make sure that Gárwig was aware that the people of Scylfig have done all they can and are awaiting the attack.
Speak with Humbald, grandson of Reeve Gárwig
'Yes, I believe we are quite ready to fight whatever dares to come our way.\n\n'I cannot wait to test my skill in battle alongside such great warriors of our realm!'
TBD
